exception(message, level=5)[source]¶

Log message and the current exception traceback

The current exception is retrieved automatically. There is no need to pass it.

@param message: The message to log @type message: string @param level: The log level @type level: int

class JumpScale.core.logging.LogHandler.LogUtils[source]¶

Bases: object

Some log related utilities.

trace(level=5, enabled=True)[source]¶

Decorator factory. Use enabled to avoid the logging overhead when it’s not needed. Do not the tracing can not be enabled or disabled at runtime.

Typical usage:

TRACING_ENABLED = True

@j.logger.utils.trace(level=3, enabled=TRACING_ENABLED) def myFunc(arg1, arg2=12):

...

@param level: level to log the calls on @type level: int @param enabled: whether or not to disable the tracing @type enabled: boolean @return: decorator factory @rtype: callable

JumpScale.core.logging.LogHandler.toolStripNonAsciFromText(text)[source]¶

Filter out characters not between ‘ ‘ and ‘~’ with an exception for newlines.

@param text: text to strip characters from @type text: basestring @return: the stripped text @rtype: basestring

JumpScale.core.logging.RedirectStreams module¶

JumpScale.core.logging.RedirectStreams.canWrite(f)[source]¶
JumpScale.core.logging.RedirectStreams.isRedirected(stream)[source]¶
JumpScale.core.logging.RedirectStreams.redirectStreams(hideoutput=False, loglevel=4, stdout=True, stderr=True)[source]¶

Redirect sys.stdout and sys.stderr to j.logger. Original streams are saved as original_stdout and original_stderr in this package @hideoutput: boolean indicating whether output must still be sent to original stderr/stdout @loglevel: log severity level to be used @stdout: boolean indicating whether sys.stdout must be redirected @stderr: boolean indicating whether sys.stderr must be redirected
